intro: Pelargonium ficaria, commonly known as the stonecrop geranium, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It features fleshy, thick leaves that are often covered in a waxy cuticle, helping it retain moisture in arid environments. The plant produces small, clustered flowers in shades of pink, red, or white, typically blooming in spring or early summer. It thrives in full sun and well-draining soil, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Its compact growth habit and ornamental appeal make it a favored plant among succulent enthusiasts.
